editorial_summary.overview: Colorful patch of flat, padded ground with numerous fountain features for kids to splash in.

reviews.text: Absolutely phenomenal! First time here with my husband and 3 small children, and ALL of us were totally WOW'd! Fantastic team providing welcoming and fun services across all the activities, facilities were convenient, the control of capacity was brilliant throughout the timed sessions, although the water kept coming on and off alot on the splash ground so, unsure whether that was intentional or not. Speaker quality wasn't great, having music helped create a vibe and atmosphere but it appeared to be connected via a poor Bluetooth connection as that kept cutting out too. Anyway, despite these couple things, it was still fantastic. Such a fabulous park providing creative activities for families, an all in one patch of endless fun. The best part of it all was that the Bounsea was located right behind the splash park, with the unicorn boat rides besides that, and a great playground in the middle of it all. A PERFECT day out for families with such value for money on the pricing of everything! üëè we are very impressed parents who believe this is massively a hidden gem in London! There are not many places like this at all!

This was wonderful on a hot day, we arrived for the first session at eleven o‚Äôclock and it wasn‚Äôt too crowded, the water jets are very varied and splashy, and the walk-on-water in huge bubbles was a great success. There are plenty of deckchairs and seats, some in the shade of trees, and the usual ice creams and slushies are available.  We didn‚Äôt go in the enormous bouncy castle obstacle course, but that looked really good from outside, too. It wasn‚Äôt cheap, but not at all bad for the entertainment it offers and we‚Äôll definitely go again.  Recommended!
Nice place and reasonably priced. Can spend time with family. Usually quite crowded on sunny weekends which makes it difficult to go with small kids

A great place for family. Huge park with swings and stuff to play with. Unicorn ride by the river, giant slide and bouncing castle with a full course with obstacles and an actual splash for kids to play in.

The entry fee is for the splash park only. We got it on a Groupon deal. The boat and ball was an additional ¬£4 each. Staff are very friendly and enthusiastic and the place is clean with toilets and changing rooms on site. It's located in the middle of the Barking park, so allow an additional 5-8min walk. We got free parking on longbridge road on a Saturday if you're lucky to get a space. The convenience was that it's local, but there are plenty of free splash parks around London which are just as good or even better.

address: Longbridge Road Inside Barking Park IG11 8SS, United Kingdom
